posts.title: Sea Shell Stipple by the Sea Shore
posts.content: Prior to taking my first drawing class at Baylor — other than seeing the art work my brother had created in high school — I had no experience with drawing. The materials had me dumbfounded and I always thought that charcoal was just something you grill with. Out of all the drawings during this class, this was the final project and the first I felt good about.

posts.title: It's finally here!
posts.content:
You are hereby invited to attend the graduation of Sir Joshua William Matz from Baylor University (Use of 'Sir' not a requirement for attendance.)

It's finally here! After 13 grueling semesters of strenuous, caffeine-filled nights and after conquering a formidable array of professors, Sir Josh is proud to be receiving a Bachelors of Fine Arts in Graphic Design from Baylor University.

To ring in the New Year, I'll promptly be moving to Austin, Texas to join the 40-hour work week crowd with Springbox, an interactive creative agency that I have been working with since September.
